message: I'm excited to offer you this fantastic product for a great price. I think you'll really love it!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Can you meet me in the middle?

I appreciate your interest in the product, but I'm afraid I can't meet you at $12000. However, I'm willing to compromise. I can offer it to you for $16000. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really get a lot of value out of it.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $16000 is still a bit out of my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $14000? I think that's a fair price for both of us.

I understand that $14000 is still a bit of a stretch for you, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $16000. However, I'm willing to make one final compromise. I can offer it to you for $16000, but I'll throw in some extras that will make it worth your while. What do you say?
